file_content.text: Hello again. I was afraid you might have forgotten our agreement, so I sent some friends to jog your memory.
I just shot a few of your pals. Hope you don't mind.
Were they close friends?
They weren't that good friends.
Call off your attack dogs, lady.
That wasn't necessary.
Gladly. All you have to do is honor your commitment.
Killing you will be fun.
Don't be tedious. We both know the last thing you want to do is kill me.
You promised to arrange a meeting for me with Diago. I want it. Now.
Diago's at a place called the Lightspring. I'll send you the coordinates.
I'll tell you where he is.
I have my own business with Diago. If I tell you where he is, you can't kill him.
Promise not to hurt him.
If you tell me where he is, I'll wait for you before I do anything. If you don't tell me, all bets are off.
You'll find Diago at an underground water well called the Lightspring.
Fair enough.
See? That wasn't so hard.
Diago has a hideout in a place called the Lightspring. Happy?
No more commandos, please.
Overjoyed. It will be an honor to finally meet him.
I just sent the all-clear signal to my soldiers. They're retreating as we speak.
Ooh... or perhaps not.
What's the matter? They can't find the exit?
Is there a problem?
Not exactly....
But I helped you.
This isn't about you. It's that irritating Jedi.
Everyone warned me not to trust a Sith. I should've listened.
I knew you were lying.
Don't be ridiculous. I'm not betraying you.
Apparently, little Nariel has decided to poke her lightsaber where it doesn't belong. She's killing my soldiers at the palace's main door.
Be a dear and throw her off our trail, then meet me at the Lightspring. I'll see you there....
I'm not convinced.
You're being a fool. Now, you'll pay the price.
I won't tell you anything.
How can you reject me? Your brain must be diseased, or something.
I'm afraid I have no choice but to order my soldiers to kill you.
There's just no reasoning with some people....
